summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys' intention to file a new bail application. The prosecutor indicates they will 'strenuously oppose bail' and acknowledges the notification from an Assistant United States Attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the bail application discussed in the email; her attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

persons.name: Boxer
persons.context: Author of the email stating they will 'strenuously oppose bail' in response to notification about Maxwell's bail application.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the initial email notifying about Maxwell's attorneys' intention to file a new bail application and offering to discuss further.

connections.description: Prosecutor notifying colleagues about Maxwell's attorneys' intention to file a bail application, indicating an adversarial legal relationship.
Colleagues or legal team members communicating about case strategy regarding opposing bail for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prosecutor stating intent to 'strenuously oppose bail' for the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Notification of intent to file bail application
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney emails colleagues to notify them that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

events.title: Prosecutor's response opposing bail
events.description: Prosecutor Boxer responds to the notification, stating they will 'strenuously oppose bail' for Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intended to file a new bail application as of December 2, 2020.
Prosecutor Boxer stated they would 'strenuously oppose bail' for Maxwell.
The correspondence is between prosecutors in the Southern District of New York regarding legal strategy in Maxwell's case.
The email contains confidentiality warnings and attorney-client privilege notices.
No specific briefing schedule or hearing date for the bail application had been set at the time of the email.
